intro: Corydalis formosana var. microphylla, commonly known as the Formosan dwarf corydalis, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and ornamental value, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
